The Claims Process

Lesson
objectives ¢ Describe the role of ClaimCenter in managing

claims

¢ Describe the process of logging in to
ClaimCenter

¢ Describe the different user roles used in
ClaimCenter

¢ Describe the general workflow of a claim

Succeed Insurance wants to make it
as easy as possible for a client to
report a claim. | need a system that
is easy to use and manages all
aspects of a claim.

Tanya

Customer

Service
Representative

aes

| ClaimCenter Internal User Types

Se adjuster = =e
—_———————— > .

ice
¢ Browser-based application
¢ Supports the most common types of internal user types:

+ Customer Service Representatives (who create claims) (CSRs)
+ Adjusters (who act on claims)
+ Supervisors (who supervise users and approve work)

When a customer calls to report a claim,
they need me to be efficient while
gathering information about their claim.

through manual creation of new claims &

Adjuster S| As a claims adjuster, | have to juggle

many tasks for multiple claims. | need
a way that | can keep track of
outstanding items and ensure that the
claims | am working on are processed
in a timely manner.

| Demonstration G

— Adjuster - The basics, claim summary,
— workplan
click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Claim Summary

« Basics
+ How long the claim has been open
+ Target closure days
+ Description

¢ Financials
* Current state of financials
* Gross incurred
+ Paid to date

¢ High-Risk Indicators
* Shows and high-risk indicators for the claim
+ Mouse over shows some details
* Shows multiple indicators if present

After the initial claim is filed, | often receive
additional information about the event.
Sometimes it doesn’t change anything, but
sometimes it changes how the claim
proceeds.

Tanvi
Adjuster \

| Demonstration G

Adjuster - Parties involved and loss
— details
click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Loss Details

General loss information is often captured
on the Loss Details screen, such as
information about:

* Description of the incident

* Details of the injured worker
* Details of the injury

* Compensability factors

Part of processing a claim is to pay the
insured the correct amount to cover the
loss. | need to be able to figure out the

correct amount and issue payment.

| Demonstration G

Adjuster - Exposures and financials

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Exposures G&G

=
=~ -—~“—“—.
coverage exposure @

policy claimant

An exposure is used to track potential payments from a claim

« Every exposure is linked to one coverage (where the money is coming from) and one claimant
(where the money is going to)

* For example, an injury at work:
+ May track payments for medical expenses

+ May track compensation for lost work time/wages

As a supervisor, | need to ensure that all
the claims assigned to my team are
processed in a timely manner. | need an
easy way to check the status of all of my
team’s activities .

Kal

Jun
Claims (5°
Supervisor ‘yaa
yx

| Demonstration G

Supervisor - The basics

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Supervisor Gi

Responsible for ensuring a group’s work is completed CO)
Handles issues that are flagged or escalated —
Cia

Approves transactions that are above the adjusters limits
Can reassign objects to other users in a group
Views summary information and team performance metrics

Adjusters can issue payments up to a

Jun

spay ss limited amount. The limits are there to

ensure that claims aren’t being overpaid. If
the payment exceeds the adjuster’s limit, |

need to verify the amount and approve the
payment.

| Demonstration G

Supervisor - Review and approve
am»
— payments
click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

| Financials approval G

cs)

“16 +$50,000

¢ ClaimCenter reviews every transaction to determine if it requires approval

* Two mechanisms for identifying transactions that require approval
« Authority limits

+ Transaction approval rules

Part of my job is to ensure that my team has Claims &

Supervisor

what they need to process claims. Sometimes,
the workload is not evenly distributed so |
need the ability to move claims from one
adjuster to another.

| Demonstration G

Supervisor - Reassign a claim

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Lesson
objectives ¢ Describe the role of ClaimCenter in managing
review ; claims

Describe the process of logging in to
ClaimCenter

¢ Describe the different user roles used in
ClaimCenter

¢ Describe the general workflow of a claim

Question G

,— — What does an end user need to access a Guidewire application?

¢
¢
¢4

-S e S  e  e H

Answer

,— — What does an end user need to access a Guidewire application?

¢
¢
7

A supported web browser and a valid username and password.

-SS SS e  e e  e H

Question G

,~ — When a user attempts to log into ClaimCenter, what three pieces of
of information does the application attempt to determine?

-S e S  e  e H

Answer G

,~ — When a user attempts to log into ClaimCenter, what three pieces of
Fa information does the application attempt to determine?

1.Whether or not the user can be authenticated,
2.What are the user's roles (permissions), and

3.What is the user's startup page.

-SS SS e  e e  e H

Question G

_— — What is one thing that determines what data is gathered on a claim intake

of screen?
4

-S e S  e  e H

Answer G

_— — What is one thing that determines what data is gathered on a claim intake
Fa screen?
7

The type of claim (personal auto, homeowners, worker's comp.)

-SS SS e  e e  e H

Question G

,— — What is the purpose of an exposure?

¢
¢
¢4

-S e S  e  e H

Answer G

a What is the purpose of an exposure?

¢
7

An exposure is used to track potential payments on one coverage, for one claimant.

-SS SS e  e e  e H

Question G

,— — What are two mechanisms used to determine if a transaction requires

of approval?
¢4

-S e S  e  e H

Answer G

_— — What are two mechanisms used to determine if a transaction requires
Fa approval?
7

Authority limits and transaction approval rules are used to identify which transactions
require approval.

-SS SS e  e e  e H
